title: BBC Local Live: Devon & Cornwall on Wednesday 31 May 2017 - BBC News
summary: suspended police officer charged with inciting a child to engage in sexual activity .
falmouth knife wound and tasering death : post-mortem 'inconclusive ' .
south west health commissioners overspend by more than £ 220m in the last financial year .
family pays tribute to boy who died after 'youth disco ' .
three arrests over newquay serious assault .
swabs left in patient at plymouth hospital , bosses confirm .
nine-thousand east devon postal voters reassured their votes will be valid despite problems with papers .
terrier gets stuck in rabbit hole .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: live updates for devon and cornwall have finished for the day , but we 'll be back at 08:00 on thursday with the latest news , sport , travel and weather .
do n't forget spotlight on bbc one later .
there will also be news through the night on your bbc local radio station .

documents.title: cornwall man tasered by police had 'heart of gold '
text: friends and family of a man who died after suffering self-inflicted knife wounds and being tasered by police have paid tribute to him .
marc cole ( right ) , 30 , from falmouth , cornwall , who died on 23 may , was described as having a `` great sense of humour '' and a `` heart of gold '' .
his brother , danny cole ( left ) , told the falmouth packet the dad-of-two had not been trying to kill himself when police were called .
`` he was well respected in the area and i have had over 400 messages from people - everyone knew my brother , '' mr cole said .
painter and decorator marc leaves behind his partner , nadine kinder , and their two sons : caden , aged three , and caleb , who is nearly one .
`` he worshipped them , they were his life , '' mr cole said .
the independent police complaints commission ( ipcc ) is investigating his death and has appealed for witnesses .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: nature reserve warbles on about frequent flyer
text: staff at a devon nature reserve have been able to record a reed warbler visiting the area during what 's believed to be its ninth migration between britain and africa , east devon district council says .
the code on a ring on the bird 's leg , which was put on by the axe estuary ringing group , revealed it was first caught on seaton wetlands as an adult in 2009 .
the group ring birds for conservation monitoring purposes and have been active on the axe estuary reserves for more than 10 years .

council reserves manager james chubb said : `` it is remarkable that this tiny little bird has made such an incredible journey not just once , but at least nine times , and each time we can be sure she is returning to the same small patch of reeds at seaton wetlands to feed and breed . ''
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: green candidate suspended for endorsing labour
text: a green party general election candidate has been suspended by his party for openly encouraging people to vote labour .
josh pope , 19 , is standing in the plymouth moor view constituency , and said he is `` disappointed but not surprised '' to be suspended .
it follows a blog expressing his hope `` to put jeremy corbyn into downing street '' by voting for labour candidate sue dann .
conservative candidate johnny mercer said it was becoming a `` farce '' .
other candidates are wendy noble , ukip and graham reed , lib dems .
a complete list can be found here .
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: metal price rises 'giving impetus to restart old mines '
text: the price of metals is continuing to rise , giving renewed impetus to attempts to restart old mines in a handful of places across the region .
the company that 's currently test-drilling for tin in east cornwall has become one of the few firms of its type to turn a profit , although that 's as a result of its mining overseas .
the price rises are historically significant .
tin prices are higher then they were through most of the 20th century , with today 's tin price about 40 % higher than 1900 in real terms .
but even with these prices , it 's far from easy to reopen an old mine .
we 've seen that at hemerdon , near plymouth .
they 've had quite bad technical teething problems and the tungsten price has been through a real wobble , but it is now moving quite steadily in the right direction .
their investors keep funding them because they think they will make money .
author: Neil Gallacher, Business & Industry Correspondent
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: military personnel 'increasingly dissatisfied with service life '
text: military personnel are increasingly dissatisfied with service life , according to the mod 's latest survey .
about 35 % of those military personnel in the army , royal navy and raf who took part in the survey said they were dissatisfied with service life in general - that 's up 4 % from 2016 .
the survey also showed a fall in satisfaction with pay and service accommodation .
overall there 's been a decline in morale , with the biggest fall among royal marines .
however , 74 % of those military personnel questioned still said they were proud to be in their service .
in devon and cornwall , military facilities in plymouth alone include devonport naval base , the headquarters of 3 commando brigade in stonehouse and an army base in the city 's citadel (
cornwall is home to facilities including rnas culdrose and hms raleigh .
author: Jonathan Beale
BBC defence correspondent

documents.title: keeper mchale eyes truro promotion push
text: goalkeeper tom mchale says truro city are capable of pushing for promotion from national league south next season .
mchale spent much of last term on loan at weymouth , but impressed on his return and has signed a one-year deal .
`` i think we 've proved , as a young group of players , that we can kick it with the big boys in that league , '' he told bbc radio cornwall .
`` i do want to repay the club and see if we can get promoted this year , and i really think that there 's an opportunity to do that with the squad we 've got now . ''
author: James Law
BBC Sport Online

documents.title: falmouth knife wound and tasering death : police watchdog carries out local enquiries
text: staff from the police watchdog have been carrying out house-to-house enquiries and gathering statements while investigating an incident where a man from falmouth died after suffering self-inflicted knife injuries and having to be tasered by police .
thrity-year-old marc cole , of the beacon in the town , died in hospital on tuesday 23 may after police were called to langton road .

the independent police complaints commission ( ipcc ) said it was gathering witness statements , including accounts from the officers involved , but added i was appealing for anyone else who saw what happened or had been in contact with mr cole to come forward .
ipcc commissioner cindy butts said : `` my thoughts are with mr cole 's family and friends and anyone affected following this traumatic event .
it is important we establish all of the circumstances surrounding police contact with mr cole prior to his death . ''
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: latest weather : getting cloudier before clearing on thursday
text: it will be mild and dry tonight with some clear spells , though the skies will tend to cloud over for many towards dawn .
patchy mist and fog may well form too .
minimum temperature : 11c ( 52f ) .
thursday will see another predominantly cloudy start , but the cloud will gradually thin to allow warm sunny spells through the afternoon .
it will feel pleasant in the sunshine too .
maximum temperature : 20c ( 68f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: students tackle flat phones
text: a group of budding entrepreneurs from the university of exeter 's falmouth campus are hoping to launch a new product that could stop us running out of phone battery when out and about .
the 'charged up ' is a portable battery that can be hired at major events to charge up your device at twice the speed .
hakeem buge ( left ) is one of the founders of the project , and says they also plan to help charities in the developing world .
`` we 'll be giving part of our proceeds to energy charities in africa .

what they do is they give people in houses and little huts solar panels , so they will be able to have electricity at night so children can do their homework and families can charge their mobile phones as well . ''
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: st erth sewage works smell 'unbearable '
text: people living in st erth say they 've been plagued by the smell coming from a sewage works in the village .
mike matthews , who has lived in st erth for more than 60 years , said the smell had become unbearable in the last few weeks .
south west water told us the recent spell of hot weather and the fact it was installing a new gas holder at the site had exacerbated the problem and it was trying hard to put it right .
author: Laurence Reed
BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: festival project sees drawing boxes on exmoor
text: sketch boxes are being left out as part of this year 's simonsbath festival on exmoor .
the tins ask you to `` scratch , scribble or scribe inside '' and are a spin off from the successful exmoor poetry box project , which collected nearly 6,000 poems over three years .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: phosphorus ordnance destroyed in controlled explosion
text: a controlled explosion has been carried out near falmouth after a fisherman dragged up a phosphorus marker whilst tending to lobster pots .
coastguards said the man sensibly left the device in the water and sailed it to gyllyngvase beach (
a bomb disposal team from plymouth moved it to a quieter spot on the helford and blew it up .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: body of man , 21 , found in exeter quay
text: the body of a 21-year-old man was discovered by police divers in exeter quay in the early hours of wednesday morning .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: broken-down vehicle on a38 tamar bridge
text: in plymouth , there 's slow traffic westbound on the a38 on the tamar bridge due to a broken-down vehicle between plymouth and saltash .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: suspended police officer charged with inciting a child to engage in sexual activity
text: a police officer who has admitted downloading child abuse images is to face a new allegation that he incited an under age girl to send him of herself .
pc jonathan fulcher , who is currently suspended , may face a trial at exeter crown court after the new charge was added to the five which he has already admitted .
his case has been adjourned until 6 july and he was released on bail .

pc fulcher , 34 , of high road , crediton , pleaded guilty at an earlier hearing to three counts of making indecent images of children , one of possession ammunition with a certificate , and one of possession of a noxious pava spray .
the new charge alleges he incited a child under 16 to engage in sexual activity and related to screenshots of an msn messenger conversation recovered from his computer .
tom bradnock , defending , said he will be asking for the new allegation to be dismissed when the case returns to court in july .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: road accident on hayle 's north quay
text: on hayle 's north quay , there 's been an accident near the swimming pool , so expect delays there .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: council sends out rubbish information about waste collections
text: we 've sent out some letters with wrong info about bin and recycling collections .
the correct info is online

documents.title: should devon install contactless donation points for the homeless ?
text: contactless donation points which allow people to give £ 2 to the homeless by tapping their card on a machine in the street have been installed in bristol .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: daley to miss british championships
text: former world champion tom daley will miss this week 's british championships in edinburgh , with a minor injury problem behind his absence from competition .
daley 's 3m mixed synchro partner , grace reid , will also miss the event in her home city .

the british championships double as qualification for great britain 's world championships team for budapest in july.however , all absent divers still have the chance of going to hungary as discretionary
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: parliamentary candidate 's posters defaced with swastikas
text: posters for south east cornwall conservative parliamentary candidate sheryll murray have been defaced with swastikas .
a photograph from ms murray 's office shows the symbol cut out twice on one poster .
ms murray said she was `` sickened '' by the attack , which she said was highly offensive to the jewish community .
other candidates standing in the constituency include : martin corney for the green party , gareth derrick for labour and liberal democrat phil hutty .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: four rescued after boat 's engine breaks down
text: the rnli has been called out to rescue four people in a rib off st ives after the boat 's engine broke down .
coastguards said four people were involved and no-one was hurt .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: dog collared after getting stuck down rabbit hole
text: a terrier dog has been rescued by firefighters after it got stuck down a rabbit hole .
a fire crew from callington was called to st giles on the heath , near launceston , at about 22:20 on tuesday .
the dog was found to be about a foot-and-a-half down the hole and was rescued by firefighters using shovels and an electric saw to reach it .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: latest weather : mainly cloudy but clearing later
text: it will be a mainly cloudy afternoon although cloud will lift to allow for some bright or sunny spells , the best of which will be in areas sheltered from the light southerly breeze .
there is also a risk of an isolated showers .
maximum temperature : 18c ( 64f ) .
it will be mild and dry tonight , with some clear spells .
it will become cloudier towards dawn with some patchy mist and fog forming too .
minimum temperature : 12c ( 54f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: in its sights !
text: we hope this is just a training exercise , not a duel !
bite work !
what if he goes for the wrong arm ?
it 'll hurt like hell i guess ?
just say 'when ' , dad .
sometimes he does n't wait for that
bet that 's when he knows you were going to say it anyway stop thinking so loud !
i do n't know who i 'm more scared of , @ twitterid or axel !
anyway you know i 'm a lover not a fighter
he 's got me firmly in his sights .
in coming ! !
makes me want to give axel a scratch between the ears with a `` go get em ''
measuring your opponent up , paw nails sharpened , teeth sharpened let 's get this done !
go get him
play nicely with the instructors but bite the baddies properly
cool next time i want to see a dog cam
better you than me !
those ears and eyes are on high alert .
target acquired !
great shot guys .
target in the crosshairs !
do n't think i would like you running at me x
got you in the crossears !
dinner dinnner dinner dinner fast food !
i hope this is just a training exercise , not a duel !

documents.title: jubilee pool penzance to open on saturday
text: west cornwall 's iconic lido swimming pool , which was meant to be reopen for the summer season last weekend , will now do so this saturday - with free entry for all .
author: Cornwall Live

documents.title: falmouth knife wound and tasering death : police watchdog appeals for witnesses
text: the police watchdog has appealed for witnesses of an incident where a man from falmouth suffered self-inflicted knife injuries and had to be tasered by police .
thirty-year-old marc cole , of the beacon in the town , died in hospital on tuesday 23 may after police were called to langton road .
officers from devon and cornwall police said they used an electric stun gun `` due to the unfolding dynamic incident '' .
the force has referred the case to the independent police complaints commission ( ipcc ) .

the ipcc said it was `` aware of a number of members of the public '' witnessed the incident , but added it was `` asking for anyone else who may have been in the area at the time and who saw mr cole to come forward '' .
a post-mortem examination carried out last week on mr cole 's body was inconclusive .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: tornado loco is n't too railroaded into new home , we hope !
text: we told you yesterday about the famous steam locomotive which is spending the half-term week in cornwall .
the tornado , the first steam engine to be built in britain since 1960 , arrived in penzance on monday after hauling a passenger service from london paddington .
she is now settling in to her temporary new home on the bodmin & wenford railway , where she is to take passengers until sunday .
managers said the train was expected to draw big crowds .
now that 's how to make an entrance .
@ twitterid appears from the shed @ twitterid more on @ twitterid
we were at bod parkway seeing my son off to cardiff when it arrived .
it was pretty amazing .
author: John Danks, BBC Spotlight

documents.title: family pays tribute to boy who died after 'youth disco '
text: the family of a boy who died in a suspected drugs related incident in a club last friday have paid tribute to the `` funny '' 16-year-old who was `` bursting with promise '' .
police believe luke campbell-tapson may have taken mdma at a `` youth disco '' held at vivid nightclub in ilfracombe on friday 26 may .
the teenager was taken to north devon district hospital where he died in the early hours of saturday .
his family said he had `` a rich and full life in front of him , and has paid a price completely out of proportion '' .
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

documents.title: plan for £ 28.5m roadworks on route off a38 set to be approved
text: plans for a £ 28.5m road scheme to widen and realign the a382 - the road which connects newton abbot with the a38 at drumbridges - will provide 'substantial public benefits ' , planners have said as they recommend approving the scheme .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: devon postal votes 'still valid ' despite problem with papers
text: nine-thousand postal voters in east devon are being reassured their votes will be valid despite a problem with the papers .
the district 's returning officer has confirmed some postal vote packs issued last week contained slips without an official security mark .
voters affected are being encouraged to return their votes as they would be counted , staff said .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: general election 2017 : south west debate
text: last night we hosted the south west general election debate at the crowne plaza hotel in plymouth .
candidates in the spotlight included :
you can see the programme above and read the live feed here .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: falmouth knife wound and tasering death : post-mortem 'inconclusive '
text: a post-mortem examination carried out on a man in falmouth who died after suffering self-inflicted knife injuries and having to be tasered by police has proved inconclusive , the police watchdog says .
marc cole , of the beacon in falmouth , died in hospital on tuesday 23 may after police were called to langton road in the town .
officers said they had to deploy the electric stun gun `` due to the unfolding dynamic incident '' .
the devon and cornwall force referred the death of the 30-year-old to the independent police complaints commission ( ipcc ) `` as per statutory guidelines '' .
the ipcc said further tests would be carried out .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: three arrests over newquay serious assault
text: three teenagers have been arrested and released over a serious assault in newquay which has left a man in a critical condition in hospital .
a 32-year-old man from newquay was punched in the head at around 04:40 on monday at the junction of beach road and gover lane in the town centre .
police said three 19-year-old men were arrested , interviewed and released under investigation whilst enquiries continue .
anybody with any information is asked to contact police on 101 .
author: Miles Davis
BBC News Online

documents.title: barnstaple theatre gets a new lease of life
text: four months after it went 'dark ' and the lights are back on at the queen 's theatre in barnstaple .
the theatre closed suddenly when the trust that ran it , and the landmark in ilfracombe , went into administration in january .
a new organisation , parkwood theatres , has taken the two venues on .
although the queen 's wo n't fully reopen until the autumn , a local theatre group is putting on a production of hairspray the musical , which opens tonight .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: water problems in torquay
text: engineers said they expected water to be be back on by 17:00 .
tq1 2 : supplies to be affected for 6 to 8 hours whilst we carry out urgent repairs .
for information : # bishopsclose

documents.title: torquay missing boy found
text: good news : kyle saint , 11 , has been found safe and well after going missing in # torquay last night .

documents.title: accident on a30 hayle bypass
text: on the a30 , on the hayle bypass heading westbound , there are reports there 's an accident .
traffic is queueing back to roseworthy .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: latest travel in devon and cornwall
text: latest travel in devon and cornwall
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: first look at new bullet trains
text: a new fleet of bullet trains is on its way to transport passengers on the penzance to london line but it will be a while before you see them on the tracks or at your local station .
author: Cornwall Live

documents.title: two arrested after tavistock burglary and suspects pursued by drone and police dog
text: two people have been arrested after burglars broke into commercial premises in tavistock , police say .
kingsbridge police said on facebook that `` balaclava-wearing suspects '' made off in a vehicle after officers were called to the site in the early hours of this morning .
the car crashed in a pursuit heading towards plymouth and those inside ran off before a police drone and police dog were used to track them .
two people have been arrested on sus of burglary and are in custody at charles cross police station .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: swabs left in patient at plymouth hospital
text: details have emerged of two more so-called `` never events '' at derriford hospital in plymouth .
the hospital trust 's latest report said four swabs were left inside one patient , which came to light in a post-operative x-ray .
another patient was given the wrong medicine during surgery .
a spokesperson for derriford said staff promptly corrected mistakes and no harm came to the patients .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: cornish pirates sign nicolas coronel and angus taylor on one-year deals
text: cornish pirates have signed argentina sevens player nicolas coronel and scotland-born australian angus taylor on one-year contracts .
coronel , 25 , can play at centre or wing and had been playing for top-tier italian side lazio .
taylor , 21 , played for redruth last season and had been on trial with championship side pirates .
`` he 's done a really good job for redruth and has ambitions to progress further , '' said coach gavin cattle .
on coronel , cattle added : `` he should certainly bring a bit of physicality to the squad , and being so versatile will add another dimension to our game . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: crumbling major devon road will cost £ 3.4m to fix
text: one of devon 's busiest roads is crumbling and will cost £ 3.4million to fix , but the council says the work will cause no extra disruption .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: newquay attack man remains in hospital
text: a man remains in hospital after being attacked in the street in newquay .
the man , in his 30s and from cornwall , was punched in the head in the attack in beach road between 04:30 and 04:45 on monday .
police said he was being treated for `` life-threatening injuries '' after being taken to derriford hospital in plymouth .
offices said they were still trawling cctv and appealing for any witnesses .
anybody with any information is asked to get in touch on 101 .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: cornwall rugby supports manchester and lancashire after attack
text: cornwall 's rugby union boss presented his lancashire counterpart with 22 roses on the pitch at twickenham before the two played the county championshp final at the weekend , to show solidarity with the people of manchester after a bomb attack .
twenty-two people were killed and 116 injured in the suicide bombing at manchester arena last week .

lancashire rfu said : `` the significance of the 22 red roses is that the red rose is the emblem of lancashire , 22 people tragically lost their lives in the atrocity , and the rugby teams are made up of 22 players . ''
lancashire rfu president tom fitzgerald ( second right ) travelled to manchester on tuesday evening and laid the flowers in st anne 's square .
author: Ross Ellis
BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: police drones and drone operator get recharged
text: now back in the office & charging everything -including a cup of tea for me- and are ready to deploy again if required .
we do n't suppose you have timed charging 6x 48s on the hex ?
trying to work out how useful it would be for us .
# please # thankyou
i have n't , but it charges them all simultaneously .
i time it next time i use it and let you know .
thanks very much guys !
who knew the police could be so helpful ?
180w singles do 40mins per bat / wondering if same or slower
very proactive deployment today .
team up in the control room very impressed .
location certainly helped .
good work by all .
# police

documents.title: football : goalkeeper tom mchale stays at truro city
text: truro city goalkeeper tom mchale says he 's delighted to sign a new deal with the club .
mchale has decided to stay with the national league south team , signing a one-year contract .
last season he had a loan spell at weymouth but established himself as the starting keeper towards the end of the season .
mchale told bbc radio cornwall : `` i 'm happy to be staying in cornwall and it 's going to be a big year .
we need to try and get in the play-offs and maybe even aim for promotion . ''
author: Ross Ellis
BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: bikers 'force cyclists off trail '
text: police say they are trying to trace scrambler motorcycle riders who forced cyclists off a trail at the weekend .
truro , perranporth & tregony police said on facebook that unlicensed off-road motorcycles were ridden on the bissoe cycle trail , between twelveheads and bissoe , at about 11:30 on sunday .
the cyclists forced off the trail `` included a four-year-old using stabilizers , a six-year-old , a seven-year-old and a nine-year-old '' , officers said .
`` this type of behaviour and disregard for cyclists and walkers legitimately using the trail will not be tolerated , '' they added .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: size 12 plymouth student criticises h & m after struggling to fit into size 16 dress
text: a student at plymouth university has criticised h & m over its dress sizes .
lowri byrne says she 's a size 12 but found it uncomfortable to wear one of the store 's size 16 outfits .
her facebook post has now been shared hundreds of times .
`` please sort your sizes out because this is absolutely ridiculous .
i 'm a size 12 and small busted and today in a h & m store i had to ask if this dress came in a size 18 ( it did n't ) , '' she wrote directly to h & m .
`` the dress i have on in these photos is a size 16 , and i could barely breathe . ''
lowri , who 's from swansea , has now finished her police and criminal justice studies course in devon .
in a statement , h & m said `` it is only ever our intention to design and make clothes that make our customers feel good about themselves , any other outcome is neither intended nor desired .
author: BBC Newsbeat

documents.title: contentious plans have been unveiled for flats and houses on two sites in porth
text: contentious plans have been unveiled for the redevelopment of two different sites in porth .
author: Cornwall Live

documents.title: weather update : cloudy day ahead , maybe some showers
text: today will see mostly cloudy skies at first , with the odd patch of early morning mist and fog possible .
however , the cloud will break to allow more in the way of sunshine by the afternoon , along with an isolated shower for some .
maximum temperature 16c ( 60f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: arrest after bus stop smashed
text: one in custody for smashing a bus stop in teignmouth

documents.title: police concerns for missing torquay boy
text: police say they 're concerned for the whereabouts of an 11-year-old boy who 's gone missing in torquay .
kyle saint was last seen yesterday , heading towards rock walk on warren road .
kyle is described as about 5ft tall , of slim build , with short brown hair .
he was wearing grey tracksuit bottoms , a light-coloured striped top and white trainers with velcro straps .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: travel update : slow-moving on the a380
text: travel update : slow-moving on the a380
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: toilet closure 'damaging beachside community '
text: traders at one north cornwall beauty spot say the continued closure of public toilets is having a damaging impact on the local community .
the beachside toilets at trebarwith strand , near tintagel , shut earlier this year when the parish council said it could no longer afford to run them .
cornwall council said it was trying to find a viable solution to re-open them , and it would continue to investigate all options .
author: Dick Straughan
BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: south west health authorities hundred of millions over budget
text: the south west 's hospitals and health commissioners overspent by more than £ 220m in the last financial year .

while some hospitals ended the year with a surplus , the unaudited figures show the biggest budget deficits were for cornwall 's health commissioners , kernow ccg , which had a deficit of more than £ 61m .
north , east and west devon commissioners came second with more than £ 42m , and derriford hospital 's trust in plymouth had a deficit of more than £ 38m .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: news , sport , weather and travel for wednesday
text: good morning from bbc local live .
we 'll be bringing you the news , sport , travel and weather for devon and cornwall today .
if you want to get in touch , please email us .
author: Sophie Malcolm
BBC News Online
